Well, the news is out. What a surreal week.

Waking up to find myself on the cover of a magazine with Andy, and then watching the story spread everywhere, was incredibly odd. To be honest, itâ€™s taken me some time to process it all.

For years, I was told that being in a public relationship could hurt my career-that Iâ€™d lose jobs and that my audience might not approve. I have been living with that fear for so long. Itâ€™s been quite toxic for my mental health. So, to be met with such an overwhelming wave of positivityâ€¦ itâ€™s been emotional. And Itâ€™s a lot to wrap my head around, but it also gives me so much hope.

This is also a thank you. Thank you for the love, and thank you for catching us on a real, human day. Andy was hugging and kissing me because I had a brutal migraine and a super stressful day (although the event was awesome) He drove me to and from work and then we went for dinner. Thatâ€™s what life is about: finding your best friend who supports you through the good and the bad.

A quick clarification since Iâ€™ve seen questions: Andy is a long-time model and video producer here in Hong Kong. No he is not mixed race. And yes, heâ€™s absolutely awesome ğŸŒŸ

Weâ€™re pretty private, so this is probably my one cheesy post - because weâ€™re the kind of couple that lives it in real time, not just online ğŸ«¶ğŸ¼
